alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 22 at 4:44PM PST until December 22 at 9:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .The heaviest precipitation has ended and additional precipitation is expected to be minimal. However, it is still possible to see additional flooding as water runs through washes and out of the higher terrain. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern California, including the following county, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 442 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yucca Valley, Joshua Tree, Joshua Tree Lake Campground and Morongo Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
